question_sentence: Which country will become the first to label individual cigarettes with health warnings?
evidence: Canadian health officials say the new regulation to label every cigarette with a warning message is part of the country’s goal to drop nationwide tobacco use to less than 5% by 2035.

question_sentence: Which cruise line recently had a ship battered by an intense storm that left water and objects flowing down interior hallways?
evidence: The cruise ship Carnival Sunshine was rocked by a storm that caused interior water damage and delayed its return to port in South Carolina.

question_sentence: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis officially kicked off his 2024 presidential campaign on Tuesday in which state?
evidence: DeSantis made his first campaign appearance in Iowa, where he pledged to take on Washington insiders and do more for Americans than his GOP rival, former President Donald Trump.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives passed a bill this week to suspend the nation’s debt limit through which date?
evidence: The House voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday to pass a bill to suspend the nation’s debt limit through January 1, 2025, as lawmakers race to prevent a catastrophic default.

question_sentence: Which company this week agreed to pay more than $30 million to settle privacy complaints?
evidence: Amazon agreed to pay a hefty sum to settle privacy complaints over its Alexa voice assistant and Ring doorbell cameras. The settlements with the Federal Trade Commission highlight claims that the company retained Ring videos and Alexa voice recordings for years.

question_sentence: Which public figure is gearing up to launch a 2024 presidential campaign in a matter of days?
evidence: Former Vice President Mike Pence will launch his 2024 presidential campaign on June 7 with an announcement video and a speech in Iowa, two sources familiar with the plans tell CNN.

question_sentence: Ford is recalling about 176,000 vehicles over difficult-to-reach seatbelts. Which model is being recalled?
evidence: The Ford Bronco is being recalled because people may get “discouraged” trying to use the seatbelts, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said.

question_sentence: The FDA this week approved a new vaccine for which common virus?
evidence: The FDA on Wednesday approved Pfizer’s RSV vaccine for older adults, the second such shot approved for the virus.

question_sentence: Which airline this week said it will begin weighing some passengers before they board the airplane?
evidence: Some international travelers leaving Auckland International Airport will soon be asked to step on the scale to help gather data on the weight load and distribution for Air New Zealand planes, the airline said.

question_sentence: According to marine researchers, which type of aquatic denizen has been increasingly detected in waters off New York and New Jersey?
evidence: Four great white sharks have been detected swimming off the coast in the past few weeks. They all appear to be making their annual migration from the Florida Keys up to the US Northeast and Canada, according to the nonprofit marine research group OCEARCH.

question_sentence: A Canadian woman won the Cooper's Hill Cheese-Rolling and Wake in England after:
Which country issued an arrest warrant for Sen. Lindsey Graham over strong comments he made in a recent video?
The Miami Heat eliminated the Boston Celtics to punch a ticket to the NBA Finals. Miami is the first No. 8 seed to advance this far since the:
True or false: Connecticut lawmakers pardoned people who were accused, convicted and executed for witchcraft in the 1600s.
HBO's "Succession," which aired its series finale this week, centers on the (fictional) Roy family, the owners of what company?
NASCAR suspended which driver after it said they intentionally wrecked Denny Hamlin during the Coca-Cola 600?
Dolly Parton broke the Guinness World Record for the most studio albums by a female country singer with how many releases?
Because of wildfire risks and an increase in construction costs, State Farm stopped providing home insurance to new customers in which state?
Which actor’s representative confirmed this week their client and his partner, who is eight months pregnant, is expecting a baby?
NASA's 16-person team of experts held a much-anticipated public hearing on UFOs this week. The panel is studying UAPs, which stands for what?
Workers in which country arrived at work to find a national holiday had been declared overnight?
evidence: The Latvian parliament met at midnight to declare a national holiday after the country’s ice hockey team won a bronze medal at the world championships.

question_sentence: What percentage of millennials (aged 25-40) believe that the Conservatives “deserve to lose the next election”?
evidence: In polling for The Times, 62% of millennials said the Tories deserved to lose the next election. Only 21% said they would vote Conservative if an election were held tomorrow.

question_sentence: What item is being sent by the UK government to New Zealand and Australia as a goodwill gesture marking the start of two new post-Brexit deals?
evidence: As the agreements between the UK and Australia, as well as the UK and New Zealand, took effect this week, various items were exchanged as goodwill gestures. Beano comics, signed by the comic’s editor, along with Penderyn single malt Welsh whisky, Brighton Gin, bags from the Cambridge Satchel Co, and Fever-Tree mixers were sent to both nations.

question_sentence: Luton Town were promoted to the Premier League after beating which team in the Championship play-off final shoot-out?
evidence: Luton Town’s win means the team will return to the top division for the first time since 1992, a season before the Premier League was created.

question_sentence: By what percentage have incidents of shoplifting risen in the year to September, according to the Office for National Statistics?
evidence: Luton Town’s win means the team will return to the top division for the first time since 1992, a season before the Premier League was created.

question_sentence: A beluga whale nicknamed Hvaldimir, who has reappeared this week, was accused of what when he was first spotted off the coast of Norway in 2019?
evidence: Hvaldimir has recently reappeared off the coast of Sweden, having spent years in Norwegian waters. When the whale first appeared four years ago, marine biologists from the Norwegian directorate of fisheries removed a harness, which had a mount suitable for an action camera and the words “Equipment St Petersburg” printed on it, leading to speculation the whale could have been part of a Russian spying programme.

question_sentence: The saliva of which animal could be the key to sprucing up your garden?
evidence: Isabella Tree, who runs the Knepp estate in West Sussex, told The Times that animal spit is the secret to growing fuller rose bushes. “If you collect some animal saliva, even if it’s pony spit or something, and anoint that little bit that you cut with your secateurs, the enzyme in the spit, the plant can read it and it goes even crazier,” she told the paper.

question_sentence: UK house prices dropped by what percentage year-on-year in May?
evidence: UK house prices have had their biggest annual fall in nearly 14 years, according to Britain’s largest mortgage lender, Nationwide. The 3.4% drop in May is the biggest since July 2009, when house prices dropped by 6.2%.

question_sentence: Which chocolate bar now has paper wrappers to make it more environmentally friendly?
evidence: Mars has swapped its wrapping from plastic to recyclable paper as part of a drive to make its products more environmentally friendly. The paper-wrapped bars have gone on sale at 500 Tesco stores, and if the trial goes well, the wrappers will be rolled out to all retailers and to other Mars treats, such as Snickers.

question_sentence: The Metropolitan Police has said it will no longer attend emergency calls linked to what type of incidents?
evidence: In a letter to health and social care bosses, Met Police commissioner Mark Rowley stated his intention to order officers not to attend mental health incidents from 31 August onwards. Rowley argued the move is necessary as officers are being “diverted from their core role of fighting crime”, calling the current situation “untenable”.
